author: Angie Chiang
contents:
Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
æ¸¬è©¦ä¸­æ–‡
The <code>emojify</code> function can be called directly in templates or Inline Shortcodes .
To enable emoji globally, set enableEmoji to true in your site’s configuration and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g.
ğŸ™ˆ :see_no_evil: ğŸ™‰ :hear_no_evil: ğŸ™Š :speak_no_evil:
The Emoji cheat sheet is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes.
title: [Template] Emoji Support

author: Angie Chiang
contents: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.
title: [Template] Markdown Syntax Guide

author: Angie Chiang
contents: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.
title: [Template] Placeholder Text

author: Hugo Authors
contents: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.
title: [Template] Rich Content

title: Math Typesetting
